summary:
The Russian Armed Forces are made up of three main branches: Ground Forces, Navy, and Aerospace Forces, along with other specialized units. They are the fifth largest military in the world, with over 1 million active soldiers and nearly 2 million reserves. Russia aims to increase its active personnel to 1.5 million by 2026.

Despite their size, Russia faces challenges. They have many nuclear weapons and a strong navy, but corruption and logistical issues have affected their performance in the Ukraine war. Russia's military spending is high, but they face setbacks in battles and equipment losses.
title: Russian Armed Forces
